He ordered Kong Yingda, a descendant of Confucius, to lecture on the Classic of Filial Piety.
He greatly recruited famous Confucian scholars to be academic officials.
Those who could understand one classic were all allowed to be appointed.
He expanded the school buildings by 1,200 rooms.
The number of students reached 3,260.
Even the cavalrymen in the camp were provided with tutors to teach them the classics.
Thus, students from all over the country, including Goguryeo and Tubo, sent their sons to study.
There were 8,000 people who attended the lectures.
The emperor, considering that there were too many interpretations, ordered Kong Yingda to compile commentaries on the Five Classics.
So that learners may practice it.
The author says:
Emperor Ming of the Han Dynasty visited the Piyong Academy.
The Confucians held the classics and asked questions.
The scholars watched from the bridge gate.
The listeners numbered in the millions.
Tang Taizong visited the Imperial University.
He ordered the chief priest to lecture on the sutra.
He increased the number of students and summoned famous Confucians to be academic officials.
The number of students from all over the country who attended the lectures reached 8,000.
How great is the prosperity of the literary governance of the Han and Tang Dynasties!
Only the two emperors have it.
In the twenty-first year,
The emperor obtained a secret prophecy saying:
After the three generations of the Tang Dynasty,
The female ruler, Empress Wu, will rule the world.
He then secretly summoned the Director of the Imperial Observatory, Li Chunfeng, to inquire about the matter.
Chunfeng said:
I calculate it with the techniques.
The signs have already formed.
Now, within the emperor's palace, after more than thirty years, there will be rule over the world.
The emperor said, Kill those who are doubtful.
In response, he said:
The Mandate of Heaven cannot be changed.
Moreover, the true king is immortal.
In vain, he causes the punishment of the doubtful and similar,
and indulges the innocent.

The emperor finally stopped. The edict said: Zuo Qiuming, Meng Ke, Guliang, Gongyang, Gao Fusheng, Mao Chang, Gao Tangsheng, Kong Anguo, Dai Sheng, Liu Xiang, He Xiu, Zheng Zhong, Ma Rong, Lu Zhi, Zheng Xuan, Fu Qian, Du Zichun, Fan Ye, Du Yu, Wang Su, and Wang Bi.
Twenty-one people.
All were enshrined in the ancestral temple of the former sages.
